revised_title: Gaseous Combustion at High Pressures: Experimental Investigations and Theoretical Analysis
tldr: This paper presents experimental investigations on gaseous combustion at high pressures, focusing on the behavior of mixtures of methane with less than its own volume of oxygen. The authors discuss the results in the light of the "hydroxylation" theory of hydrocarbon combustion and provide an experimental determination of the relative affinities of methane, hydrogen, and carbon monoxide for oxygen in flames.
